Which of the following, if true, would best support the opinion of the above-mentioned experts? 1) Most Mayan cities declined between 850 AD and 925 AD, which coincides with the time of drought. 2) Between 1000 AD and 1075 AD, stone carvings and other construction activities in the Mayan area were reduced by nearly half, and the local area suffered another severe drought at that time. 3) Like all large-scale farming civilizations, the Mayan society relied heavily on crops. Drought caused a decrease in agricultural products, which seriously affected the survival of the Maya. 4) The Mayan cities that declined in the 9th century were mostly distributed in the south, and the construction activities using wood were also greatly reduced.
answer: 2: Like all large-scale farming civilizations, the Mayan society relied heavily on crops. Drought caused a decrease in agricultural products, which seriously affected the survival of the Maya.

question: From 2005 to 2009, over 80% of graduates from Zenith University were able to secure employment within their first six weeks of graduation. Prospective engineering students should ttherefore choose Zenith University, if they want to be employed within six weeks of graduating. Which of the following, if true, would most strengthen the argument? 1) Since 2005, the number of jobs for engineers has not significantly decreased. 2) The economy has been doing well, though analysts forecast that there will be a recession that could last for as long as five years. 3) Compared to all other degrees conferred by Zenith University, engineering degrees were the most likely to result in employment within six weeks. 4) Many Zenith University students who were not able to secure employment within six weeks often found jobs soon after.
answer: 4: Compared to all other degrees conferred by Zenith University, engineering degrees were the most likely to result in employment within six weeks.

question: Criminals often have an unusual self-image. Embezzlers often think of their actions as only borrowing money. Many people convicted of violent crimes rationalize their actions by some sort of denial; either the victim deserved itand so the action was justified, or it simply wasn't my fault.  Thus, in many cases, by criminals' characterization of their situations, __. Which one of the following most logically completes the passage? 1) they ought to be rewarded for their actions 2) they deserve only a light sentence for their crimes 3) their actions are not truly criminal 4) they are perceived to be the victim of some other criminal
answer: 1: their actions are not truly criminal

question: According to statistics, about 5000 elderly people commit suicide in Japan every year, accounting for 3/10 of the number of suicides, which can be called the big country of elderly suicide in the world. Among them, the suicide rate of divorced men is 8 times that of those with spouses, and the suicide rate of divorced women is 4 times that of those with spouses. Which of the following views does the above paragraph directly support? 1) In Japan, the phenomenon of elderly divorce is more common. 2) The elderly in Japan have heavy economic burden and great living pressure. 3) Most suicides suffer from senile psychosis. 4) Widowhood and loneliness are the important causes of suicide among the elderly in Japan.
answer: 3: Widowhood and loneliness are the important causes of suicide among the elderly in Japan.

question: Supporting foreign rating agencies to enter China's inter-bank bond market and exchange bond market to carry out all kinds of bond rating business is a major measure to expand the opening up of China's financial market. As an important basic institutional arrangement of the financial market, with the acceleration of the internationalization of China's financial market, the introduction of international credit rating agencies to carry out rating business in China will help to meet the diversified needs of international investors, improve the rating quality of China's rating industry, and contribute to the standardized and healthy development of China's financial market. Which of the following options is highlighted in this passage? 1) Measures related to the opening of credit rating to the outside world 2) The significance of credit rating opening to the outside world. 3) The planning and deployment of credit rating opening to the outside world. 4) The basic connotation of credit rating opening to the outside world.
answer: 3: The significance of credit rating opening to the outside world.

question: Zeida: Dr. Ladlow, a research psychologist, has convincingly demonstrated that his theory about the determinants of rat behavior generates consistently accurate predictions about how rats will perform in a maze. On the basis of this evidence, Dr. Ladlow has claimed that his theory is irrefutably correct. Anson: Then Dr. Ladlow is not a responsible psychologist. Dr. Ladlow' s evidence does not conclusively prove that his theory is correct. Responsible psychologists always accept the possibility that new evidence will show that their theories are incorrect. Anson bases his conclusion about Dr. Ladlow on which one of the following? 1) the rejection of a theoretical explanation 2) the use of an ambiguous term 3) the application of a general principle 4) the discrediting of facts
answer: 1: the application of a general principle

question: In the past ten years, the number of doctoral degrees awarded every year in China has continued to rise, so it can be considered that the number of graduate students in China has been increasing in the past ten years. Which of the followings best supports the above conclusion? 1) The number of people who apply for PhD student this year is about twice that of ten years ago. 2) In the past ten years, the proportion of the number of students who got doctoral degrees in China in the total number of graduate students has remained unchanged. 3) In the past ten years, the difficulty of obtaining a doctoral degree has not changed. 4) This year, China's PhD students accounted for only about 20% of graduate students.
answer: 2: In the past ten years, the proportion of the number of students who got doctoral degrees in China in the total number of graduate students has remained unchanged.

question: Although the technology of self-driving is updated so fast that the public is dizzying. But so far, no company has launched a complete and mature product and most companies are still stuck in self-driving testing. For a new technology, the closer the test is to the real environment, the more accurate the results will be. However, cars are different from other products, once an accident occurs, it will endanger public safety. As a result, driverless towns were born based on this demand. At present, Shanghai, Zhejiang, Beijing and other places are scrambling to build self-driving towns and the enthusiasm of local governments has greatly promoted the further research of self-driving. Technology is important, but it is clearly not the only decisive link in the future self-driving field. Which of the following options is intended to describe the self-driving industry? 1) Technology is not the only determinant of its development. 2) It is favored by more and more local governments. 3) There is no way for it to leave the intervention and support of the government. 4) It faces many unresolved technical barriers.
answer: 4: There is no way for it to leave the intervention and support of the government.

question: The setting of majors in colleges and universities should be the result of multiple considerations by colleges and universities, government, market and society. Too much emphasis on one aspect will inevitably lead to imbalance. To achieve a relatively reasonable and balanced, it is necessary to provide a platform in the system, such as ensuring that the university is collectively demonstrated by the professor committee or academic committee when setting up majors. Educational authorities should also promote and respect the modern university governance model, and give professional organizations more autonomy in professional settings. After eliminating unreasonable institutional factors, when evaluating majors in colleges and universities, it is possible for society to treat the employment status of different majors with a rational and peaceful attitude, instead of equating the red card of the employment rate with bad majors. Which of the followings is this text meant to emphasize? 1) Employment rate is not the only criterion for evaluating the quality of a profession. 2) Educational authorities should give universities more autonomy. 3) Various factors should be considered in the professional setting of colleges and universities. 4) System construction is the basis to ensure the rationality of professional evaluation.
answer: 3: Various factors should be considered in the professional setting of colleges and universities.

question: Analyst: Any new natural-gas-powered electrical generation station needs to be located close to a natural-gas pipeline, a large body of water for cooling, and transmission lines. It also must be situated in a region where residents will not oppose construction. Our country has an extensive system of transmission lines, but our natural-gas pipelines run in the vicinity of only three of our large bodies of water, and residents would oppose any significant construction projects near these bodies of water. The analyst's statements, if true, most strongly support which one of the following statements about the analyst's country? 1) There currently is no natural-gas-powered electrical generation station near any of the three largest bodies of water. 2) If a new natural-gas -powered electrical station is built in a region, many residents will move away from that region. 3) No site would be suitable for constructing a natural-gas-powered electrical station unless the existing system of natural-gas pipelines is expanded. 4) Future electrical needs will have to be met by alternatives to natural-gas-powered generation.
answer: 4: No site would be suitable for constructing a natural-gas-powered electrical station unless the existing system of natural-gas pipelines is expanded.

question: There are many variables that determine the level of health, including social, cultural, economic and other factors. One problem that may hinder the improvement of health level is the accumulation of social and economic inequality. In the past 25 years, a series of cross-border empirical studies have distinguished social and economic inequality. It is linked to morbidity, mortality, life expectancy, and medical service levels. Research has found that under the same conditions, the more unfair a country is, the worse its health. Based on this passage, we can conclude that: 1) In the past ten years, the national income of country B has increased, nutrition has improved, and the resources invested by the state in health care have also increased. Then compared with ten years ago, the health level of nationals of country B must be greatly improved. 2) In the use and enjoyment of social, cultural, and economic resources, the nationals of country A have received a lot of fairness, then the health of the nationals of country A must be very high. 3) A country's inequality in social, cultural, economic and other aspects is likely to be transformed into inequality in medical services, which will affect the health of its citizens. 4) The morbidity, mortality and life expectancy of a country's nationals are determined by whether the country's social economy is equal and its degree of equality.
answer: 3: A country's inequality in social, cultural, economic and other aspects is likely to be transformed into inequality in medical services, which will affect the health of its citizens.

question: One night in October 2005, farmer Liu ate a carp fished from the pond. Soon he suddenly felt dizzy, had unbearable abdominal pain, had spasms of hands and feet, vomited constantly, had a high fever, and soon died of gas. After detailed tests by the health department, Liu's death was related to eating carp. Environmentalists tested the water quality of the pond and found that as local farmers washed pesticide utensils in the pond for years, the fish slowly saved enough poison to kill people. According to the above conclusion, which of the following is correct? 1) Carp in the pond can't be eaten 2) Great efforts should be made to popularize the knowledge of pesticide safety among farmers 3) Liu ate too much and died of poisoning 4) The carp itself has a strong ability to resist poison
answer: 3: Great efforts should be made to popularize the knowledge of pesticide safety among farmers

question: Peter's principle, also known as the upward climbing principle, is a conclusion drawn by American scholar Lawrence Peter based on the analysis of thousands of incompetent failures in relevant organizations, that is, in various organizations, because they are used to promoting people who are competent at a certain level, employees always tend to be promoted to their incompetent position. According to the above definition, which of the following options conforms to Peter's principle? 1) Li was appointed as a middle manager because his father-in-law was a director of the company, but he was unable to do so because he had no relevant experience. 2) Zhao was recently promoted to department manager because of his strong business ability and outstanding performance. 3) Zhang, an excellent women's volleyball player, was hired as a coach by the national women's volleyball team after retirement, and his work was highly recognized. 4) Oakman is an outstanding technician at Lyme Auto repair Company. When the company promoted him to executive director, he was very busy, tired and unfulfilled every day.
answer: 4: Oakman is an outstanding technician at Lyme Auto repair Company. When the company promoted him to executive director, he was very busy, tired and unfulfilled every day.

question: In a social survey, it was found that the per capita GDP of city A was higher than that of cities B and C, while the per capita GDP of city D was higher than that of city C and lower than city E. Which of the following can be derived from this? 1) The per capita GDP of City is higher than that of City C 2) The per capita GDP of City E is higher than that of City A 3) The per capita GDP of city A is higher than that of city D 4) Among the five cities' per capita GDP, City C ranks fourth most
answer: 4: Among the five cities' per capita GDP, City C ranks fourth most

question: The people who participated in the lecture had connections with the military. All of them believed that UFO really existed, and most of them thought that UFO should be studied. Although the lecture held by the National Atomic experiment museum was small, the speakers were very credible. It can be seen that some very rigorous scientists also believed that UFO really existed. Which of the followings, if true, best supports the above argument?? 1) Some of the participants in the lecture are very rigorous scientists 2) Some of the speakers are not rigorous scientists 3) Some scientists are associated with the military 4) Scientists' lectures are very rigorous and credible
answer: 3: Some of the participants in the lecture are very rigorous scientists

question: Flow rate refers to the amount (volume or mass) of fluid (liquid or gas) passing through a specific surface per unit time. When the amount of fluid is expressed by volume, it is called volume flow; when the amount of fluid is expressed by mass, it is called mass flow. According to the above definition, which of the following options contain descriptions of volume flow? 1) The Caspian Sea is located at the junction of inland Europe and Asia. It is the largest saltwater lake in the world. It has 130 rivers that enter the sea, and its water storage capacity has reached 76,000 square kilometers 2) The Amazon River meanders 6,440 kilometers, with a drainage area of 6.915 million square kilometers. The water that is injected into the Atlantic Ocean every year accounts for one-sixth of the total amount of the world's rivers into the ocean 3) The Victoria Falls is located in the border area of Zambia and Zimbabwe in Africa. When the Zambezi River is full, 7,500 cubic meters of water per second will rush over 4) The Japanese warm current is in the open sea to the east of Taiwan Island. Its width is about 100 to 200 kilometers, and its depth is 200 meters. The maximum flow rate can reach 60 to 90 kilometers per day and night
answer: 3: The Victoria Falls is located in the border area of Zambia and Zimbabwe in Africa. When the Zambezi River is full, 7,500 cubic meters of water per second will rush over

question: String pair means that in a verse or couplet, the sentence and the pair are not opposite in meaning and grammatical structure, but are inherited from top to bottom. The two sentences cannot be separated from each other or reversed. There is a certain sequence in their language structures. According to the above definition, which of the followings is a string pair? 1) If you want to cross the mountain of knowledge, you must take the road of diligence. If you want to cross the ocean of knowledge, you must use diligence as a boat to cross the sea. 2) Never give in to the enemy and be willing to serve the people. 3) If you want to see enough scenery and scenery for thousands of miles, you have to go up to a higher tower. 4) The waves in the Wu Gorge are monstrous, and the dark clouds seem to be pressing down on the ground. The sky and the earth are gloomy.
answer: 1: If you want to see enough scenery and scenery for thousands of miles, you have to go up to a higher tower.

question: A researcher studied makeup photos of 100 deceased athletes and divided them into three types based on their facial expressions : deadpan , toothy smile and big laugh . The researchers found that of the 100 deceased athletes, the deadpan lived to an average of 72.9 years, the grins lived to about 75 years and the big laughs lived to 79.9 years. The researchers therefore believe that attitudes can affect how long people live. Which of the following, if true, most questions the researcher's claim? 1) 'Big laugh' athletes tend to be more sociable and have higher emotional intelligence 2) The 100 athletes are different in nationality and sport 3) The expression on a set photo can say a lot about a person's attitude to the world 4) What kind of facial expression the athletes take is determined by the photographer's request
answer: 3: What kind of facial expression the athletes take is determined by the photographer's request

question: Colorless diamonds can command high prices as gemstones. A type of less valuable diamonds can be treated to remove all color. Only sophisticated tests can distinguish such treated diamonds from naturally colorless ones. However, only 2 percent of diamonds mined are of the colored type that can be successfully treated, and many of those are of insufficient quality to make the treatment worthwhile. Surely, ttherefore, the vast majority of colorless diamonds sold by jewelers are naturally colorless. A serious flaw in the reasoning of the argument is that 1) information about the rarity of treated diamonds is not combined with information about the rarity of naturally colorless, gemstone diamonds 2) the difficulty that a customer of a jeweler would have in distinguishing a naturally colorless diamond from a treated one is not taken into account 3) comparisons between the price diamonds command as gemstones and their value for other uses are omitted 4) the currently available method for making colorless diamonds from colored ones is treated as though it were the only possible method for doing so
answer: 1: information about the rarity of treated diamonds is not combined with information about the rarity of naturally colorless, gemstone diamonds

question: A legal person refers to an organization that has the capacity for civil rights and civil conduct, independently enjoys civil rights and undertakes civil obligations according to law. A legal person must meet four conditions: it must be established according to law; it must be independently operated property; it must have a clear organization, name and place; and it must be able to independently bear civil liability. According to the above definition, which of the following is a legal person? 1) Shaanxi Military Region 2) State owned department store 3) Provincial Higher Education Self Examination Office 4) School of Arts, Renmin University of China

Social insurance is enforced among all or some citizens through national legislation, while commercial insurance mainly depends on commercial principles, which is a kind of contractual relationship. Which of the following options primarily supports this view? 1) Social insurance and commercial insurance should not be handled together 2) The legalization of social insurance and commercial insurance should be strengthened 3) It is better to unify the administrative institutions and policies of social security 4) Social insurance and commercial insurance can be handled interchangeably
answer: 2: Social insurance and commercial insurance can be handled interchangeably

question: Crowded living conditions lead to a significant decline in the health of citizens, which is a major problem facing City A. Because City A and City B have the same area and population, the above problems faced by City A are bound to arise in City B. Which of the following can best refute the above conclusion? 1) Fail to accurately distinguish between the two concepts of a city's area and population 2) Ignoring the fact that the same population density can have different living conditions 3) Crowded living conditions are the only reason for the decline in the health of citizens 4) Fail to accurately distinguish between the two concepts of population size and population density
answer: 4: Ignoring the fact that the same population density can have different living conditions

question: Essayist: Computers have the capacity to represent and to perform logical transformations on pieces of information. Since exactly the same applies to the human mind, the human mind is a type of computer. The flawed pattern of reasoning in which one of the following most closely resembles the flawed pattern of reasoning in the essayist's argument? 1) Often individual animals sacrifice their lives when the survival of their offspring or close relatives is threatened. It is probable, ttherefore, that there is a biological basis for the fact that human beings are similarly often willing to sacrifice their own well-being for the good of their community. 2) Friendship often involves obligations whose fulfillment can be painful or burdensome. The same can be said of various forms of cooperation that cannot strictly be called friendship. Thus cooperation, like friendship, can require that priority be given to goals other than mere self-interest. 3) In any organism, the proper functioning of each component depends upon the proper functioning of every other component. Thus, communities belong to the category of organisms, since communities are invariably characterized by this same interdependence of components. 4) In the plastic arts, such as sculpture or painting, no work can depend for its effectiveness upon a verbal narrative that explains it. Since the same can be said of poetry, we cannot consider this characteristic as a reasonable criterion for distinguishing the plastic arts from other arts.
answer: 1: In any organism, the proper functioning of each component depends upon the proper functioning of every other component. Thus, communities belong to the category of organisms, since communities are invariably characterized by this same interdependence of components.

question: An enterprise as a legal person shall be one who has such legal conditions as the amount of capital, the name of the enterprise, its articles of association, its organizational structure and its domicile as prescribed by the laws of the State, and can independently bear civil liabilities; Social and economic organizations approved and registered by the competent authorities to obtain legal person status. According to the above definition, which of the following is an enterprise as a legal person? 1) The chicken factory that villager Zhao mou individual proprietorship builds in the village 2) The business liaison office of a multinational company in China 3) A state-owned tractor manufacturer on the verge of bankruptcy 4) D. Mr. Song and his wife work at a clothing sales booth in the mall
answer: 3: A state-owned tractor manufacturer on the verge of bankruptcy

question: Li Lin is a civil servant, but not a college graduate Which of the following conclusions is certain? 1)  Not all college graduates are civil servants 2)  Some civil servants are college graduates 3)  Some college graduates are not civil servants 4)  Not all civil servants are college graduates
answer: 2:  Not all civil servants are college graduates

question: Most galaxies are moving away from us, and their receding speed (redshift) is proportional to the distance of the galaxies. This proportional coefficient, now known as the Hubble constant, represents the current rate of expansion of the universe. One of the core tasks of observational cosmology is to measure the relationship between distance and redshift. it describes the history of cosmic expansion, answers basic questions about the age, geometry and composition of the universe, and even tests many new physical predictions. In astronomical observations, the redshift of distant celestial bodies can be accurately obtained, but the accurate measurement of distance has always been the biggest problem for astronomers. Which of the following options is most likely to be discussed by the author next? 1) How astronomers accurately measure distance . 2) How astronomers accurately measure redshift. 3) Difficulties encountered in the measurement of distances. 4) Breakthroughs in the measurement of distances.
answer: 4: Breakthroughs in the measurement of distances.

question: It is often said that reading can increase knowledge and cultivate temperament. Some experts have pointed out that reading can also cure diseases, especially for mental illnesses caused by some social factors, such as depression, depression, panic, worry, etc., reading has a good effect. Which of the following, if true, can best support the opinions of the above-mentioned experts? 1) Reading can prompt patients to change their way of thinking, improve their cognitive ability, re-understand the world and recognize themselves 2) Patients can get emotional recognition and comfort from reading intentionally or unintentionally, and release their inner anxiety and anxiety 3) Liu Xiang, an enquirer at the University of the Han Dynasty, attaches great importance to the medical effect of reading 4) Reading can produce a neuropeptide in the brain, which can enhance cellular immunity and is beneficial to human health
answer: 2: Patients can get emotional recognition and comfort from reading intentionally or unintentionally, and release their inner anxiety and anxiety

question: As a teacher, whether you realize it or not, you are half an actor. Some people have a stronger sense of character, some people have a weaker sense of role, some people have better acting ability, and some people are weaker. In the case of similar knowledge and insight, the degree of teaching effect is reflected in the difference between performance consciousness and performance ability. Which of the following options does this passage mainly support such a point of view? 1) Teachers' performance consciousness and ability affect the teaching effect. 2) Teachers should take the classroom as a stage and act as actors themselves. 3) Knowledge, insight and performance are all required courses for teachers. 4) Teachers with strong acting ability often have good teaching results.
answer: 2: Teachers' performance consciousness and ability affect the teaching effect.
